label: Stripe API
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Stripe API.

tools.name: DeleteAccountPerson
tools.description:
Delete a person's relationship to an account in Stripe.

Deletes a person's relationship to the account's legal entity in Stripe, except for the account_opener or the sole verified executive.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the account from which a person's relationship will be deleted. This must be a valid Stripe account ID.

parameters.name: person_id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the person whose relationship to the account will be deleted. This is required and must be a valid person ID in Stripe.

tools.name: DeleteAccountPersonRelationship
tools.description:
Remove a person's relationship from a Stripe account.

This tool deletes an existing person's relationship to a Stripe account's legal entity. It cannot delete the account opener or the only verified executive, if applicable.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Stripe account from which the person's relationship will be removed. This ID is required to specify the correct account.

parameters.name: person_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the person whose relationship to the account is to be removed.

tools.name: DeleteApplePayDomain
tools.description:
Delete an Apple Pay domain from Stripe.

Use this tool to delete a specific Apple Pay domain registered with your Stripe account. This is useful for managing domains no longer required for Apple Pay services.

parameters.name: apple_pay_domain_to_delete
parameters.description: The domain name of the Apple Pay domain you wish to delete from your Stripe account.

tools.name: DeleteCustomerTaxId
tools.description:
Deletes a customer's existing tax ID.

This tool is used to remove an existing tax ID associated with a specific customer in Stripe. Call this tool to manage customer tax ID records by deleting unnecessary or outdated entries.

parameters.name: customer_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the customer whose tax ID will be deleted. This is a string provided by Stripe.

parameters.name: tax_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the tax ID to be deleted for the customer.

tools.name: DeleteExternalAccount
tools.description:
Delete a specified external account for a given account.

Use this tool to delete an external account linked to a specific account. Ideal for managing external accounts by removing unwanted or outdated entries.

parameters.name: account_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the account from which the external account will be deleted.

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the external account to be deleted.

tools.name: DeleteExternalBankAccount
tools.description:
Delete an external bank account for a specified account.

Use this tool to remove a specified external bank account from a given account. It confirms the successful deletion.

parameters.name: account_identifier
parameters.description: The account ID from which you want to delete an external bank account.

parameters.name: external_account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the external bank account to be deleted.

tools.name: DeleteInvoiceDraft
tools.description:
Permanently delete a draft invoice.

Use this tool to permanently delete a draft invoice that is not finalized or associated with a subscription. Once deleted, this action cannot be undone.

parameters.name: invoice_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the draft invoice to be permanently deleted. Cannot be used on finalized invoices or those associated with subscriptions.

tools.name: DeleteInvoiceItem
tools.description:
Delete an invoice item from a draft or unattached invoice.

Use this tool to delete an invoice item that isn't attached to a final invoice or is part of a draft invoice.

parameters.name: invoice_item_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the invoice item to be deleted. It must be either unattached or part of a draft invoice.

tools.name: DeleteProductFeature
tools.description:
Delete a specific feature from a product.

Use this tool to delete a feature attached to a specific product by providing the product and feature identifiers.

parameters.name: feature_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the feature to be deleted from the product.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the product from which the feature is to be deleted. This is required to specify which product's feature should be removed.

tools.name: DeleteStripeConnectedAccount
tools.description:
Delete managed accounts via Stripe Connect.

Use this tool to delete accounts you manage through Stripe Connect. Suitable for test-mode accounts anytime and live-mode accounts except those with standard dashboard access or negative balances. Ensure all balances are zero before deletion.

parameters.name: account_id_to_delete
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Stripe account to be deleted. Ensure this is a managed account with zero balance.

tools.name: DeleteStripeCoupon
tools.description:
Delete a coupon in Stripe without affecting current users.

Use this tool to delete a coupon on Stripe, preventing new customers from redeeming it. Existing customers with the coupon remain unaffected.

parameters.name: coupon_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the coupon to delete on Stripe. This ID specifies which coupon should be deleted.

tools.name: DeleteStripeCustomer
tools.description:
Permanently delete a Stripe customer and cancel subscriptions.

Use this tool to permanently delete a customer in Stripe. This action cannot be undone and will immediately cancel any active subscriptions associated with the customer.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the customer to be deleted. This ID is required and should match the customer in the Stripe system.

tools.name: DeleteStripePlan
tools.description:
Delete a specified plan from Stripe.

Use this tool to delete a plan in Stripe, preventing new subscriptions to that plan while keeping existing subscribers unaffected.

parameters.name: plan_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the plan to be deleted in Stripe.

tools.name: DeleteStripeProduct
tools.description:
Delete a product from Stripe if eligible.

This tool deletes a product from Stripe, provided the product has no prices or SKUs associated with it. Use this to remove products when cleaning up a catalog or managing inventory.

parameters.name: product_id_to_delete
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the product to delete. Ensure the product has no prices or SKUs associated with it.

tools.name: DeleteStripeValueList
tools.description:
Delete a Stripe Radar ValueList and its items.

Use this tool to delete a specified ValueList object in Stripe Radar, along with all its contained items. Ensure the ValueList is not referenced in any rules before calling this tool.

parameters.name: value_list_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the ValueList to be deleted. Ensure it is not referenced in any rules before deletion.

tools.name: DeleteStripeWebhookEndpoint
tools.description:
Delete a Stripe webhook endpoint by ID.

Use this tool to delete a specific webhook endpoint in Stripe by providing its ID, helping manage webhook configurations.

parameters.name: webhook_endpoint_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Stripe webhook endpoint you wish to delete. This ID is required to specify which endpoint should be removed from your Stripe configurations.

tools.name: DeleteTaxId
tools.description:
Delete a tax ID from an account or customer.

Use this tool to delete an existing tax ID associated with an account or customer in Stripe.

parameters.name: tax_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the tax ID to be deleted. This should be the specific tax ID string associated with an account or customer in Stripe.

tools.name: DeleteTerminalConfiguration
tools.description:
Deletes a terminal configuration.

Use this tool to delete a specific terminal configuration in Stripe by providing the configuration ID.

parameters.name: configuration_id_to_delete
parameters.description: The ID of the terminal configuration you want to delete from Stripe.

tools.name: DeleteTerminalLocation
tools.description:
Deletes a specified terminal location in Stripe.

Use this tool to delete a specific terminal location in Stripe by providing the location identifier. It removes the location object from the terminal services.

parameters.name: location_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the terminal location to delete.

tools.name: DeleteTerminalReader
tools.description:
Delete a terminal reader from the Stripe account.

This tool is used to delete a terminal reader object in a Stripe account. It should be called when there is a need to remove a specific reader.

parameters.name: terminal_reader_id
parameters.description: The ID of the terminal reader to be deleted from the Stripe account.

tools.name: DeleteTestClock
tools.description:
Deletes a test clock in Stripe's test environment.

This tool is used to delete a specific test clock from Stripe's test environment. Call this tool when you need to remove a test clock that is no longer needed.

parameters.name: test_clock_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test clock to be deleted from Stripe's test environment.

tools.name: DownloadQuotePdf
tools.description:
Download the PDF for a finalized Stripe quote.

Use this tool to retrieve the PDF document for a completed quote from Stripe. It's useful when you need to obtain the finalized quote in PDF format for record-keeping or sharing purposes.

parameters.name: quote_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the finalized quote to download as a PDF. This ID is required to retrieve the specific quote.

parameters.name: expand_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields in the quote response that should be expanded for additional detail.

tools.name: GetAccountCapabilities
tools.description:
Retrieve capabilities associated with a Stripe account.

This tool returns a list of capabilities for a specified Stripe account, sorted by their creation date.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Stripe account for which to retrieve capabilities. This is a required field.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields to expand in the response, specified as strings.

tools.name: GetAccountCapabilityDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific account capability.

This tool fetches information about a specific capability of an account in Stripe. It should be called when there's a need to understand the capabilities available on an account.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Stripe account whose capability information is being requested.

parameters.name: account_capability_identifier
parameters.description: A unique identifier string for the specific capability of the account to be retrieved. This is essential to specify which capability's details you want to fetch from Stripe.

parameters.name: expand_fields
parameters.description: List of fields in the response to expand for detailed information.

tools.name: GetActiveEntitlements
tools.description:
Retrieve active entitlements for a customer from Stripe.

This tool fetches a list of active entitlements for a specific customer using Stripe's API. It's used when you need to know what entitlements a customer currently has.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the customer whose active entitlements are being retrieved.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before
parameters.description: An object ID cursor to fetch the previous page of the list of active entitlements.

parameters.name: expand_fields_in_response
parameters.description: An array of field names to be expanded in the response from Stripe. Use this to include additional details related to specific entities.

parameters.name: max_number_of_entitlements
parameters.description: Maximum number of active entitlements to retrieve for the customer, between 1 and 100. Default is 10.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after
parameters.description: Use this to specify where to start the list pagination. Provide the object ID from where the list should continue.

tools.name: GetApplicationFeeRefunds
tools.description:
Retrieve refunds for a specific application fee.

Use this tool to access more than the default 10 refunds associated with a specific application fee, using pagination parameters if needed.

parameters.name: application_fee_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the application fee for which refunds are being retrieved. This ID specifies which fee's refunds should be listed.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor_ending_before
parameters.description: An object ID cursor used for pagination to fetch the previous page of refunds.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields in the response to expand for additional details.

parameters.name: maximum_number_of_refunds
parameters.description: The maximum number of refund objects to return, ranging from 1 to 100. Defaults to 10 if not specified.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after
parameters.description: An object ID to fetch the next page of refunds after this ID, used for pagination.

tools.name: GetBalanceSettings
tools.description:
Retrieve balance settings for a connected Stripe account.

Use this tool to obtain the balance settings associated with a specific connected account in Stripe. Useful for managing and reviewing account financial settings.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response that should be expanded for the connected Stripe account's balance settings.

tools.name: GetBalanceTransactionById
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a balance transaction by ID.

Call this tool to get comprehensive information about a specific balance transaction using its ID.

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the balance transaction to be retrieved.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response that should be expanded for additional details.

tools.name: GetBillingAlert
tools.description:
Retrieve billing alert details by ID.

This tool retrieves billing alert information from Stripe using a specific alert ID. It should be called when you need details about a particular billing alert.

parameters.name: billing_alert_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the billing alert to retrieve details for.

parameters.name: expand_fields
parameters.description: List of fields in the response that should be expanded.

tools.name: GetBillingAlerts
tools.description:
Retrieve active and inactive billing alerts.

Use this tool to list all current billing alerts, both active and inactive, from Stripe.

parameters.name: filter_by_alert_type
parameters.description: Filter results to only include alerts of the specified type. Accepts 'usage_threshold'.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before
parameters.description: A pagination cursor. Use this ID to fetch the previous page of the list if starting from a specific object.

parameters.name: expand_response_fields
parameters.description: List of fields in the response that should be expanded. Each field should be a string.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of billing alerts to be returned. Accepts an integer from 1 to 100. Defaults to 10 if not provided.

parameters.name: filter_by_meter
parameters.description: Filter results to only include alerts related to a specific meter type.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after
parameters.description: Cursor indicating the starting point for fetching the next page of alerts. Use an object ID from a previous response.

tools.name: GetBillingCreditGrants
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of billing credit grants.

Use this tool to retrieve information about billing credit grants from Stripe. It should be called when you need details about existing credit grants.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the customer whose credit grants you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before
parameters.description: An object ID to fetch the previous page of the list. Use the last received object's ID from the current page.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields to be expanded in the response for detailed information.

parameters.name: credit_grant_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of credit grants to return, between 1 and 100. Defaults to 10 if not specified.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor (object ID) for pagination to fetch the next page in the list. Use the ID from the last object in the previous list.

tools.name: GetBillingMeterEventSummaries
tools.description:
Retrieve billing meter event summaries by meter ID.

Call this tool to get a list of billing meter event summaries for a specific meter ID, providing insights into billing events and activities.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the customer for which to fetch event summaries.

parameters.name: stop_aggregating_until
parameters.description: The exclusive timestamp to stop aggregating meter events. Ensure it aligns with minute boundaries.

parameters.name: start_time_timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp to begin aggregating meter events (inclusive). Must align with minute boundaries.

parameters.name: meter_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the billing meter to fetch event summaries for.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before_id
parameters.description: An object ID for pagination, used to fetch the previous page of a list. Aligns the list cursor to end before the specified object ID.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response that should be expanded for detailed results.

parameters.name: number_of_objects_limit
parameters.description: A limit on the number of billing meter event summaries to be returned. Must be between 1 and 100, with a default of 10.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after_id
parameters.description: The object ID to use as a cursor to fetch the next page of the list for pagination.

parameters.name: granularity_for_event_summaries
parameters.description: Specifies the granularity for event summaries: 'hour' or 'day'. If not set, returns a single summary for the time range.

tools.name: GetBillingMeters
tools.description: Retrieve a list of billing meters from Stripe.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before
parameters.description: An object ID cursor to fetch the previous page, used for pagination.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: An array of strings specifying which fields in the response should be expanded.

parameters.name: number_of_billing_meters
parameters.description: Specify the number of billing meters to return, ranging from 1 to 100 (default is 10).

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor ID to define your starting point in the list for pagination. Use this to fetch the next page of results.

parameters.name: filter_status
parameters.description: Filter results to include only billing meters with the specified status. Options are 'active' or 'inactive'.

tools.name: GetBillingPortalConfigurations
tools.description:
Retrieve customer portal configurations from Stripe.

Provides configurations that describe the functionality of the billing customer portal. Useful for understanding available setups and settings for customer management.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor_ending_before
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination to get the previous page in the list, using an object ID.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields in the response to be expanded. Each entry should be a string representing a field name.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Specify the number of configurations to return, between 1 and 100. Default is 10.

parameters.name: pagination_start_after_id
parameters.description: A cursor object ID used to fetch the next page of the list for pagination.

parameters.name: only_active_configurations
parameters.description: Set to true to list only active configurations, or false to list inactive ones.

parameters.name: return_default_configurations_only
parameters.description: Set to true to return only default configurations, or false to return non-default configurations.

tools.name: GetChargeDisputeDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a dispute for a specific charge.

Use this tool to fetch information about a dispute associated with a particular charge. This is helpful when you need to understand the dispute details for a specific transaction processed via Stripe.

parameters.name: charge_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the charge for which you want to retrieve dispute details.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand_in_dispute_response
parameters.description: List of fields to expand in the dispute response for additional details.

tools.name: GetChargeRefunds
tools.description:
Retrieve refunds for a specific charge on Stripe.

This tool retrieves a list of refunds associated with a specific charge on Stripe. It provides access to more than the 10 most recent refunds by allowing pagination through the 'limit' and 'starting_after' parameters.

parameters.name: charge_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the charge for which to retrieve refunds. This ID is required to specify the particular charge.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before
parameters.description: Specify an object ID to fetch the previous page of refunds before this object.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields to expand in the response for more detailed information.

parameters.name: object_return_limit
parameters.description: Specify the number of refunds to return, ranging from 1 to 100. Defaults to 10 if not set.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after
parameters.description: ID of the object to start retrieving the next page from. Used for pagination in refund lists.

tools.name: GetCheckoutSessionLineItems
tools.description:
Fetch line items from a Stripe Checkout Session.

Use this tool to retrieve line items associated with a specific Stripe Checkout Session, including a paginated list if required.

parameters.name: checkout_session_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Stripe Checkout Session. This ID is required to retrieve associated line items.

parameters.name: cursor_ending_before
parameters.description: An object ID used for pagination to retrieve the page before the specified object in the list.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response that should be expanded for additional details.

parameters.name: item_limit
parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of line items to return, ranging from 1 to 100. Default is 10.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after
parameters.description: A string representing the object ID to start the list after, for pagination purposes.

tools.name: GetClimateOrderDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific Climate order.

Use this tool to get information about a Climate order based on its ID.

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the Climate order to retrieve details.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response that should be expanded for more detailed information.

tools.name: GetConfirmationTokenInfo
tools.description:
Retrieves details of an existing confirmation token.

This tool is used to retrieve information about a specific ConfirmationToken object in the Stripe system. It should be called when there is a need to obtain the details of a previously generated confirmation token.

parameters.name: confirmation_token
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the confirmation token to retrieve details for. This is required.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields to expand in the response for additional details. Each field should be specified as a string.

tools.name: GetCountrySpecifications
tools.description:
Retrieve country specifications using a country code.

This tool is used to obtain the specifications for a specific country by providing its country code. It should be called when information related to the country's financial regulations, formats, or other specifications is needed.

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for which you want to retrieve specifications. For example, 'US' for the United States.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response to be expanded. Each field should be specified as a string.

tools.name: GetCouponDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a coupon by its ID.

Use this tool to fetch information about a specific coupon available in your Stripe account, identified by its unique ID.

parameters.name: coupon_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the coupon to retrieve details.

parameters.name: expanded_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response that should be expanded for additional details.

tools.name: GetCreditBalanceTransaction
tools.description:
Retrieve a credit balance transaction by ID.

Use this tool to obtain information about a specific credit balance transaction using its ID.

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the credit balance transaction to be retrieved.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: An array of field names to expand in the response. Allows accessing nested information related to the transaction.

tools.name: GetCreditBalanceTransactions
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of credit balance transactions.

This tool calls the Stripe API endpoint to fetch credit balance transactions. It should be used to review or analyze credit activity associated with billing accounts.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the customer for which to fetch credit balance transactions.

parameters.name: credit_grant_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the specific credit grant to fetch its credit balance transactions.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_cursor
parameters.description: A pagination cursor ID to fetch the previous page of the list. Use an object ID to identify your position.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields in the response that should be expanded for additional details.

parameters.name: max_transactions_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of transactions to return, ranging between 1 and 100. The default is 10.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after
parameters.description: An object ID cursor to fetch the next page of credit balance transactions.

tools.name: GetCreditReversalDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific CreditReversal using its ID.

Use this tool to fetch information about an existing CreditReversal by providing its unique ID. Ideal for confirming details or reviewing the status of a CreditReversal transaction.

parameters.name: credit_reversal_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the CreditReversal to retrieve details for. This ID is obtained from the CreditReversal creation request or list.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response that should be expanded for more detailed information.

tools.name: GetCreditReversals
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of Credit Reversals from Stripe's Treasury.

This tool fetches a list of Credit Reversals from Stripe's Treasury endpoint. It should be used when detailed information about credit reversals is needed.

parameters.name: financial_account_id
parameters.description: The ID of the FinancialAccount associated with the CreditReversals to be returned.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before
parameters.description: A cursor object ID for pagination to fetch the previous list page.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields to be expanded in the response for detailed information.

parameters.name: max_objects_returned
parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of credit reversals to be returned. Valid range is 1 to 100, defaulting to 10.

parameters.name: filter_by_received_credit_id
parameters.description: Filter Credit Reversals to only include those associated with the specified ReceivedCredit ID.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after_cursor
parameters.description: An object ID used to fetch the next page of the list in a paginated response.

parameters.name: credit_reversal_status
parameters.description: Filter CreditReversals based on their status. Possible values are: canceled, posted, processing.

tools.name: GetCurrentAccountBalance
tools.description:
Retrieve the current account balance from Stripe.

Use this tool to get the current account balance based on the authentication used. It's helpful for accessing up-to-date financial data from the Stripe account.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields to expand in the response for additional details.

tools.name: GetCustomerBalanceTransaction
tools.description:
Retrieve a specific customer balance transaction from Stripe.

This tool retrieves details about a specific balance transaction that impacted a customer's balance in Stripe.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the customer. This is required to retrieve the specific balance transaction.

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the customer balance transaction to retrieve.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields to expand in the response for additional details.

tools.name: GetCustomerBalanceTransactions
tools.description:
Retrieve a customer's balance transaction updates.

Fetches a list of transactions that have updated a customer's balance within Stripe.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the customer. This ID is used to retrieve balance transaction updates for that specific customer.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor ID used to fetch the previous page of balance transactions in pagination.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response that should be expanded.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of balance transactions to retrieve, ranging from 1 to 100. Default is 10.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination. Use the object ID from the last received page to fetch the next page.

tools.name: GetCustomerBankAccountDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a customer's bank account from Stripe.

Use this tool to get specific details about a bank account associated with a Stripe customer. It helps when you need information beyond the most recent sources shown by default.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Stripe customer whose bank account details are being retrieved.

parameters.name: bank_account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the specific bank account associated with the Stripe customer.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields in the response to expand for detailed information.

tools.name: GetCustomerBankAccounts
tools.description:
Retrieve bank accounts for a specific customer.

Call this tool to obtain a list of bank accounts associated with a particular customer. Useful for viewing more than the 10 most recent bank accounts when paginating.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the customer whose bank accounts you want to retrieve. This ID is required to access the bank account details associated with a specific customer.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before
parameters.description: An object ID used as a cursor to fetch the previous page of bank accounts in a paginated list.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields to expand in the response. Specify which aspects of the response should be expanded for detailed information.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of bank accounts to return, ranging from 1 to 100. Defaults to 10 if not specified.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor_starting_after
parameters.description: A string specifying the object ID to define your place in the list for pagination. Use this to fetch the next page of bank accounts.

tools.name: GetCustomerCardDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details about a specific card for a customer.

This tool retrieves information about a specific card associated with a customer, allowing you to access details beyond the most recent 10 cards available directly on the customer object.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the customer whose card details are being retrieved. This is required to specify which customer's card information you want to access.

parameters.name: card_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the card to retrieve details for. This is specific to the card associated with the customer.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response that should be expanded for more detailed information.

tools.name: GetCustomerCards
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of cards belonging to a customer.

Use this tool to access a list of cards for a specific customer in the Stripe system. This is useful when more than the 10 most recent card sources are needed.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the customer whose cards are to be retrieved. This ID is required to obtain the card list.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before
parameters.description: Object ID to define the cursor's place in pagination, used to fetch the previous page of the card list.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields in the response to be expanded for additional details.

parameters.name: card_retrieval_limit

parameters.name: subscription_item_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the subscription item to retrieve details for.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response to be expanded for detailed information.

tools.name: RetrieveSubscriptionSchedule
tools.description:
Get details of an existing subscription schedule by ID.

This tool retrieves the detailed information of an existing subscription schedule using its unique identifier. It should be called when detailed information about a subscription schedule is needed.

parameters.name: subscription_schedule_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the subscription schedule to retrieve details for.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand_in_response
parameters.description: A list of fields to expand in the response for additional details.

tools.name: RetrieveTaxCalculation
tools.description:
Retrieve a specific tax calculation by its ID.

This tool retrieves details of a Tax Calculation object using its unique ID, provided the calculation has not expired. It is useful for obtaining information on specific tax calculations.

parameters.name: tax_calculation_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Tax Calculation object to retrieve.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields to expand in the response. Use to get detailed subfields of tax calculations.

tools.name: RetrieveTaxCalculationLineItems
tools.description:
Retrieve line items for a Stripe tax calculation.

Use this tool to get the line items of a tax calculation from Stripe, provided the calculation hasn't expired.

parameters.name: tax_calculation_id
parameters.description: The ID of the tax calculation to retrieve line items for. Ensure that the calculation has not expired.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor_ending_before
parameters.description: An object ID to define your place in the list for pagination, used to fetch the previous page.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response to be expanded. Use this to include additional data in the output.

parameters.name: object_return_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the number of objects to return, between 1 and 100. Default is 10.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after_item_id
parameters.description: An object ID used for pagination to fetch the next page of results.

tools.name: RetrieveTaxId
tools.description:
Retrieve an account or customer's tax_id object.

Use this tool to retrieve detailed information about a specific tax_id associated with an account or customer on Stripe.

parameters.name: tax_id_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the tax_id object to be retrieved. This is a required field to specify which tax_id you want information about.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields in the response that should be expanded for detailed information.

tools.name: RetrieveTaxRate
tools.description:
Fetches a tax rate by its ID from Stripe.

Use this tool to retrieve specific tax rate information from Stripe using the tax rate ID. It provides the details associated with the particular tax rate.

parameters.name: tax_rate_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the tax rate to be retrieved from Stripe. This ID is required to fetch the specific tax rate details.

parameters.name: expand_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to be expanded in the response. This allows you to retrieve additional nested information related to the tax rate.

tools.name: RetrieveTaxTransaction
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific tax transaction.

This tool retrieves a Tax Transaction object from the Stripe API, providing detailed information about a specific tax transaction.

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the tax transaction to retrieve.

parameters.name: expand_response_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields to expand in the tax transaction response for additional details.

tools.name: RetrieveTerminalConfiguration
tools.description: Retrieves a terminal configuration object for Stripe.

parameters.name: configuration_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the terminal configuration to retrieve.

parameters.name: expand_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields in the terminal configuration response that should be expanded for more details.

tools.name: RetrieveTerminalLocation
tools.description:
Fetches details of a terminal location by ID.

Use this tool to obtain information about a specific terminal location from Stripe by providing the location ID.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the terminal location to retrieve information for.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields in the response to expand for additional details.

tools.name: RetrieveTerminalReader
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a terminal reader.

This tool retrieves a specific terminal reader object from the Stripe API. It should be called when detailed information about a particular reader is needed.

parameters.name: terminal_reader_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the terminal reader to retrieve. It should be a string value.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response that should be expanded for more detail.

tools.name: RetrieveTestClock
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a Stripe test clock.

This tool retrieves information about a specific test clock within Stripe's test environment. It should be used to gather details about test clocks for testing purposes.

parameters.name: test_clock_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test clock to retrieve from Stripe.

parameters.name: expand_fields
parameters.description: A list of strings specifying which fields in the response should be expanded for additional details.

tools.name: RetrieveTransactionEntry
tools.description:
Fetches details of a specific treasury transaction entry.

Use this tool to retrieve detailed information about a specific transaction entry from Stripe's treasury system by providing the transaction entry ID.

parameters.name: transaction_entry_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the treasury transaction entry to retrieve.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: An array of field names to include in the response for additional detail.

tools.name: RetrieveTreasuryTransactionDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific treasury transaction.

This tool retrieves the details of an existing treasury transaction by its ID. Use it when you need to access specific information about a treasury transaction in Stripe.

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: The ID of the treasury transaction you want to retrieve details for.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields in the treasury transaction response to be expanded, specified as an array of strings.

tools.name: RetrieveValueListItem
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific ValueListItem in Stripe Radar.

This tool retrieves information about a specific ValueListItem object from Stripe's Radar service, which can be used to manage elements within its fraud prevention tools.

parameters.name: value_list_item_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the ValueListItem to retrieve from Stripe's Radar service.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the ValueListItem response to expand for additional details.

tools.name: RetrieveVerificationSessionDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a Stripe verification session.

Use this tool to get information about a specific Stripe VerificationSession. It's helpful when the session status is 'requires_input' to obtain a valid client_secret or URL for re-submission.

parameters.name: verification_session_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Stripe VerificationSession to be retrieved.

parameters.name: expand_response_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response to be expanded for additional details. Use this to customize the verbosity of the response.

tools.name: RetrieveWebhookEndpoint
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specified webhook endpoint by ID.

This tool retrieves information about a Stripe webhook endpoint using its ID. Use it when you need to get details such as status, URL, and events for a specific webhook endpoint.

parameters.name: webhook_endpoint_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Stripe webhook endpoint you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields to expand in the response, specified as strings.

tools.name: SearchStripeCustomers
tools.description:
Search and retrieve customer data from Stripe.

Use this tool to search for customers that have been previously created in Stripe using their Search Query Language. Note that search may not reflect the most recent updates instantly and may experience delays during outages. This tool is not available for use in India.

parameters.name: search_query_string
parameters.description: The search query string used to search for customers. Refer to Stripe's Search Query Language documentation for syntax and supported fields.

parameters.name: expand_response_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response that should be expanded. Provide the field names as strings.

parameters.name: customer_result_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of customer records to return, between 1 and 100. Default is 10.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for paginating through results. Use 'next_page' from a previous response for subsequent results. Omit on the first call.

tools.name: SearchStripeInvoices
tools.description:
Search for previously created Stripe invoices.

This tool searches for invoices you've previously created using Stripe's Search Query Language. It should not be used in read-after-write flows needing strict consistency. Data is typically searchable within a minute but could take up to an hour during outages. Not available for merchants in India.

parameters.name: search_query_string
parameters.description: The search query string using Stripe's Search Query Language. Refer to Stripe's documentation for syntax and supported fields.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response to be expanded for additional details. Provide field names as strings.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Defines the maximum number of invoice records to return, ranging from 1 to 100. Defaults to 10 if not specified.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination to retrieve subsequent pages. Use the next_page value from a previous response; exclude for the first call.

tools.name: SearchStripePaymentIntents
tools.description:
Search previously created Stripe PaymentIntents.

Use this tool to search for PaymentIntents that you have previously created on Stripe using their Search Query Language. Note that search results might be slightly delayed, so avoid using this tool in scenarios needing strict consistency immediately after data changes.

parameters.name: search_query_string
parameters.description: The search query to find specific PaymentIntents using Stripe's Search Query Language. Refer to the documentation for query syntax and fields.

parameters.name: expand_fields
parameters.description: A list of specific fields in the response that should be expanded. Use field names as strings.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Number of PaymentIntent objects to return, ranging from 1 to 100, with a default of 10.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the 'next_page' value from a previous response to request more results.

tools.name: SearchStripePrices
tools.description:
Search for previously created Stripe prices.

Use this tool to search for prices you have previously created on Stripe using the Stripe Search Query Language. Note that this function should not be used for read-after-write flows where strict consistency is necessary, as data may take some time to propagate.

parameters.name: search_query_string
parameters.description: The search query string for prices using Stripe's Search Query Language. Refer to the documentation for syntax and supported fields.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of fields in the response that should be expanded.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of price objects to return. Must be between 1 and 100, with a default of 10.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for paginating through results. Omit on first call; use 'next_page' from a prior response for additional results.

tools.name: SearchStripeProducts
tools.description:
Search for previously created products on Stripe.

Use this tool to search for products you have created on Stripe. It utilizes Stripe's Search Query Language for querying. Note that the search may not be suitable for transactions needing strict consistency, as data may be slightly outdated. Also, this service isn't available in India.

parameters.name: search_query_string
parameters.description: The search query string to find products. Refer to Stripe's Search Query Language for syntax and available fields.

parameters.name: response_fields_to_expand
parameters.description: List of specific fields to expand in the response for detailed information. Use field names as strings.

parameters.name: results_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of product results to return, ranging from 1 to 100. Defaults to 10 if not set.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor for paginating through the results. Use the 'next_page' value from the previous response for subsequent pages. Do not include this on the first call.

tools.name: SearchStripeSubscriptions
tools.description:
Search previously created Stripe subscriptions.

Use this tool to search for subscriptions created with Stripe using their Search Query Language. This is ideal for retrieving subscription data, but not suitable for scenarios requiring strict consistency, such as immediately after creating or updating data. Note: This functionality isn't available for merchants in India.

parameters.name: search_query_string
parameters.description: The search query string used to filter Stripe subscriptions. Refer to the Stripe Search Query Language documentation for syntax and query fields.

parameters.name: expand_fields
parameters.description: A list of fields in the Stripe subscription response to be expanded. This allows accessing additional data for each subscription object.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of subscription results to return, from 1 to 100. Default is 10.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for paginating through results. Omit on first call; use next_page value from a prior response for subsequent results.

tools.name: StripeSearchCharges
tools.description:
Search for previously created charges using Stripe.

Use this tool to search for charges you've created with Stripe using their Search Query Language. It's not suitable for scenarios needing strict consistency. Data may take up to an hour to appear during outages, and the feature is unavailable in India.

parameters.name: search_query_string
parameters.description: The search query string using Stripe's Search Query Language to filter charge results. Refer to Stripe's documentation for syntax and fields.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response that should be expanded for additional detail.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Specify the number of charge objects to return. The limit can be between 1 and 100, with a default of 10.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the 'next_page' value from the previous response for subsequent requests. Omit on the first call.

summary:
# Overview
The StripeApi toolkit enables LLMs to directly interact with the Stripe API, facilitating seamless operations related to payments, account management, and customer interactions.

## Capabilities
- Manage customer accounts, payment methods, and transactions.
- Retrieve detailed financial data and reports.
- Perform search operations for financial entities following Stripe's Search Query Language.
- Delete accounts, invoices, and payment methods efficiently.

## OAuth
This toolkit does not support OAuth as authentication.

## Secrets
- **Secret Type**: api_key 
  - **Example**: STRIPE_API_KEY
